actions.committee: Senate Committee on Labor and Public Welfare
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Labor and Public Welfare.

official_title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, as amended, to prohibit the use of any name in connection with any prescription drug other than the official name designated or such drug by the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare.

summary.text: Directs the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare to designate an official name for any new drug subject to prescription sale and for all drugs presently subject to such sale, within one year after the date of enactment of this Act. Provides that drugs labeled or advertised by any name other than the official name shall be deemed to be misbranded. Authorizes the Secretary to exempt drugs from carrying the official name for one year in order to avoid confusion or to permit the orderly transition to revised labeling. Requires that drug labels be printed in type which is conspicuous.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act, as amended, to prohibit the use of any name in connection with any prescription drug other than the official name designated or such drug by the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare.
